content.text:
# List of Hillary Clinton 2008 presidential campaign endorsements

This is a list of prominent individuals and organizations who formally endorsed or voiced support for Hillary Clinton as the Democratic Party's presidential nominee for the 2008 U.S. presidential election.
U.S. Presidents and Vice Presidents
* Fmr. President Bill Clinton
* Fmr. Vice-president Walter Mondale
Senators
* Sen. Evan Bayh (D-IN)
*Sen. Blanche Lincoln (D-AR)
* Sen. Maria Cantwell (D-WA)
* Sen. Dianne Feinstein (D-CA), Chairwoman of the Rules and Administration Committee
*Sen. Daniel Inouye (D-HI), Chairman of the Commerce, Science and Transportation Committee
* Sen. Tim Johnson (D-SD)
* Sen. Robert Menendez (D-NJ)
* Sen. Barbara Mikulski (D-MD) [http://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/ws/?pid=92761#axzz2irgMgYuF]
* Sen. Patty Murray (D-WA)
* Sen. Bill Nelson (D-FL) [https://www.huffingtonpost.com/2008/01/25/exclusive-sen-bill-nelson_n_83286.html]
* Sen. Mark Pryor (D-AR) [http://politics.nytimes.com/election-guide/2008/supertuesday/democraticpreview/index.html]
* Sen. Chuck Schumer (D-NY) [https://www.nytimes.com/2006/12/09/nyregion/09hillary.html]
* Sen. Debbie Stabenow (D-MI)
* Sen. Sheldon Whitehouse (D-RI)
* Fmr. Sen. John Breaux (D-LA)
* Fmr. Sen. John Glenn (D-OH), former NASA astronaut, 1984 presidential candidate [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pZs5NOAGlf0]
* Fmr. Sen. Dee Huddleston (D-KY) [http://www.hillaryclinton.com/news/release/view/?id=7731 HillaryClinton.com - Media Release]
* Fmr. Sen. Robert Burren Morgan (D-NC)
* Fmr. Sen. Claiborne Pell (D-RI) [https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2008/03/01/AR2008030100894.html]
* Fmr. Sen. Robert Torricelli (D-NJ) [http://politickernj.com/torricelli-hillary-15784]

* Fmr. Secretary of Housing and Urban Development Henry Cisneros

* Fmr. Democratic National Committee Chair Terry McAuliffe [http://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2008/01/04/clinton-camp-looks-to-feb-5/]

* Fmr. White House Chief of Staff Leon Panetta [https://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/nation/la-na-delegates6mar06,0,6609153.story]

* Fmr. United States Ambassador to the United Nations Andrew Young [https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601070&refer=home&sid=a3gQMXfUoDX8]
* Kathleen Kennedy, daughter of Robert F. Kennedy and Ethel Kennedy
* Kerry Kennedy, daughter of Robert F. Kennedy and Ethel Kennedy and a human rights activist
* Robert F. Kennedy, Jr., an environmentalist and a member of the Kennedy family

* Gov. Ted Strickland (D-OH)
* Fmr. Gov. Tom Vilsack (D-IA)
* Fmr. Gov. John Y. Brown, Jr. (D-KY) [http://blog.hillaryclinton.com/blog/main/2008/05/14/201604 HillaryClinton.com - blogHillary]
* Fmr. Gov. Julian Carroll (D-KY)
* Fmr. Gov. Wendell Ford (D-KY),
* Fmr. Gov. Paul E. Patton (D-KY) [http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/K/KY_CLINTON_KENTUCKY_KYOL-?SITE=KYLOU&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT&CTIME=2008-04-03-22-34-29]

* Fmr. Gov. Pedro Rossello (PR)
* Fmr. Gov. Hulett Smith (D-WV)
* Fmr. Gov. John Waihee (D-HI) [https://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=19108871]
* Fmr. Gov. Brendan Byrne (D-NJ)
Family members of major political figures
* Fmr. Kentucky First Lady Phyllis George[http://www.hillaryclinton.com/news/release/view/?id=7685 HillaryClinton.com - Media Release]
* Anthony Shriver, founder of Best Buddies International and a member of the Kennedy family
Mayors
* Allentown, PA Mayor Ed Pawlowski (D-PA)
* Boston, MA Mayor Thomas Menino (D-MA) [https://www.boston.com/news/local/articles/2007/10/27/speculation_swirls_over_meninos_plans/]

* Kalispell, Montana Mayor Pam Kennedy (MT) [http://www.hillaryclinton.com/news/release/view/?id=7709 HillaryClinton.com - Media Release]
* Los Angeles, CA Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa (D-CA) [https://www.nytimes.com/2007/05/30/us/politics/30clinton.html?_r=1&ref=politics&oref=slogin]
* Morgantown, West Virginia Mayor Ron Justice (D-WV)
* Oakland, CA Mayor Ron Dellums(D-CA)[http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2007/10/02/MND6SI0OH.DTL&hw=dellums+clinton&sn=004&sc=749]

* Williamstown, West Virginia Mayor Jean Ford (WV)

*Parma City Council President Sean P. Brennan
